intro: Acmenosperma, commonly known as the red gum or white box, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. Acmenosperma species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in dry, sandy soils. They play an important role in the ecosystems of arid and semi-arid regions. The genus is noted for its ecological significance and is often used in revegetation projects.
